titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Eugenie V. Mielczarek papers, 1965-1997

change.item: Converted to schema conforming EAD by dtd2schema.vh.xsl.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Libraries. Special Collections Research Center.

did.abstract: This collection contains materials relating to the scientific and academic career of Eugenie V. Mielczarek in the area of physics, primarily at George Mason University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the Eugenie Mielczarek papers must be obtained from Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Eugenie Mielczarek papers, C0059, Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by Eugenie Mielczarek in 1998.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections Research Center staff. EAD markup completed by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty in April 2009. Inventory and Finding Aid completed by Emily Curley and Brittney Falter in July and August 2017.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Eugenie Vorburger Mielczarek was the first woman physicist at George Mason University and served on several faculty committees. She has written on biophysics and on women in the sciences. Her publications include two books: 'Iron, Nature's Universal Element: Why People Need Iron and Animals Make Magnets,' coauthored with Sharon Bertsch McGrayne; and 'Biological Physics,' coedited with Elias Greenbaum and Robert S. Knox. Mielczarek passed away at the age of 86 on June 26, 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials relating to the scientific and academic career of Eugenie V. Mielczarek in the area of physics, primarily at George Mason University. Items include scientific data and research results, conference information, grant proposals, speaking engagements, presentations, correspondence, and publications. Prominent is information relating to national and local organizations of women scientists, including material about women scientists at GMU.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by subject.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections Research Center also holds the .

appraisal.head: Appraisal note
appraisal.p: Documents related to hiring, human resources, student conduct, student grades,and personally identifiable information have been removed according to Library of Virginia records retention schedule.

controlaccess.corpname: George Mason University. Dept. of Physics and Astronomy.
